metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from site No.7 eddy covariance system (EC) in the flux observation matrix from 29 May to 18 September, 2012. The site (100.36521° E, 38.87676° N) was located in a cropland (maize surface) in Yingke irrigation district, which is near Zhangye, Gansu Province. The elevation is 1556.39 m. The EC was installed at a height of 3.8 m; the sampling rate was 10 Hz. The sonic anemometer faced north, and the separation distance between the sonic anemometer and the CO2/H2O gas analyzer (CSAT3&Li7500A) was 0.15 m.
Raw data acquired at 10 Hz were processed using the Edire post-processing software (University of Edinburgh, http://www.geos.ed.ac.uk/abs/research/micromet/EdiRe/), including spike detection, lag correction of H2O/CO2 relative to the vertical wind component, sonic virtual temperature correction, coordinate rotation (2-D rotation), corrections for density fluctuation (Webb-Pearman-Leuning correction), and frequency response correction. The EC data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods. Moreover, the observation data quality was divided into three classes according to the quality assessment method of stationarity (Δst) and the integral turbulent characteristics test (ITC), which was proposed by Foken and Wichura [1996]: class 1 (level 0: Δst<30 and ITC<30), class 2 (level 1: Δst<100 and ITC<100), and class 3 (level 2: Δst>100 and ITC>100), representing high-, medium-, and low-quality data, respectively. In addition to the above processing steps, the half-hourly flux data were screened in a four-step procedure: (1) data from periods of sensor malfunction were rejected; (2) data before or after 1 h of precipitation were rejected; (3) incomplete 30 min data were rejected when the missing data constituted more than 3% of the 30 min raw record; and (4) data were rejected at night when the friction velocity (u*) was less than 0.1 m/s. There were 48 records per day; the missing data were replaced with -6999. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
The released data contained the following variables: data/time, wind direction (Wdir, °), wind speed (Wnd, m/s), the standard deviation of the lateral wind (Std_Uy, m/s), virtual temperature (Tv, ℃), H2O mass density (H2O, g/m^3), CO2 mass density (CO2, mg/m^3), friction velocity (ustar, m/s), stability (z/L), sensible heat flux (Hs, W/m^2), latent heat flux (LE, W/m^2), carbon dioxide flux (Fc, mg/ (m^2s)), quality assessment of the sensible heat flux (QA_Hs), quality assessment of the latent heat flux (QA_LE), and quality assessment of the carbon flux (QA_Fc). In this dataset, the time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30; the data were stored in *.xlsx format.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2016) (for multi-scale observation experiment or sites information), Xu et al. (2013) (for data processing) in the Citation section.

该数据集包含了2012年5月29日至9月18日的通量观测矩阵中7号点的涡动相关通量观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市盈科灌区农田内，下垫面是玉米。观测点的经纬度是100.36521E, 38.87676N，海拔1556.39m。涡动相关仪架高3.8m，采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向是正北向，超声风速仪与CO2/H2O分析仪之间的距离是15cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据为10Hz，发布的数据是采用Edire软件后处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Edire软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据每30min内缺失率大于3%的数据；（4）剔除夜间弱湍流的观测数据（u*小于0.1m/s）。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。因仪器漂移等原因引起的可疑数据用红色字体标识。
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间Date/Time，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），稳定度Z/L（无量纲），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为三级（质量标识0:（Δst <30, ITC<30）; 1: （Δst <100, ITC<100）; 其余为2）。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。
多尺度观测试验或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2016)，观测数据处理请参考Xu et al.(2013)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况下。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果的比较。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的，这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性增加，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度的过高估计。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米高度的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高度使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高度测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组分温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组分温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。接着，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水文遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强对流条件下，TSEB模型仍能产生可靠的E/ET%和T/ET%比率及ET的估计。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2，与EC系统的测量值相比。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值很好地一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 在异质表面上生态水文过程的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。

methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个涡度（EC）塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区规模上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计，覆盖了FEA区域。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

Definition.QuestionEn: What are the main challenges associated with measuring evapotranspiration using remote sensing in heterogeneous landscapes?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中，使用遥感测量蒸散发的主要挑战是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: The main challenges associated with measuring evapotranspiration using remote sensing in heterogeneous landscapes include the complexity of separating soil and canopy component temperatures due to mixed pixel classifications and the strong advective conditions found in certain agricultural areas. Additionally, uncertainties in temperature measurements can arise from errors in image classification, atmospheric radiation influences, and the estimation of incoming solar radiation transmittance, which can affect the accuracy of models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model used to estimate evapotranspiration.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中使用遥感测量蒸散发的主要挑战包括由于混合像元分类而导致的土壤和冠层温度分离的复杂性，以及某些农业地区存在的强烈平流条件。此外，温度测量中的不确定性可能源于图像分类错误、大气辐射影响以及入射太阳辐射透过率估算的误差，这些都可能影响像两源能量平衡（TSEB）模型等用于估算蒸散发的模型的准确性。

Comparison.AnswerEn: Incomplete energy balance closure in eddy covariance measurements is primarily due to uncertainties in available energy calculations, while thermal infrared temperature estimation challenges arise from errors in component temperature separation and atmospheric effects. Both challenges impact the accuracy of heat flux estimations in strongly advective areas.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在涡度协方差测量中，能量平衡闭合不完全主要是由于可用能量计算中的不确定性，而热红外温度估计的挑战则源于组分温度分离和大气效应中的误差。这两种挑战都影响了强对流区域热通量估计的准确性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the application of the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model in heterogeneous landscapes aid in refining data collection methods for evapotranspiration measurements?

Interpretation.AnswerEn: The TSEB model allows for more accurate estimations of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration by considering the separate soil and canopy components in heterogeneous landscapes. This model has undergone revisions to improve the estimation of net radiation, aerodynamic resistance, and component temperatures, which helps refine data collection methods by requiring only a single measurement of land surface temperature.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: TSEB模型通过考虑异质景观中土壤和树冠的独立组成部分，能够更准确地估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散。该模型经过修订，以改善净辐射、气动阻力和组成温度的估算，这有助于通过仅需一次地表温度测量来精炼数据收集方法。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges arise when using multiscale observation techniques to study eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems, and how can these challenges be addressed?

Interpretation.AnswerEn: The primary challenge is the poor availability of multiscale observations, which hinders the progress in understanding eco-hydrological processes. Addressing these challenges involves the use of hierarchically nested scales of instrumentation, such as eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations, as well as a combination of airborne remote sensing missions and ground measurements, to capture data across different spatial scales.

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the underlying causes of errors in component temperature estimations using thermal infrared cameras?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 使用热红外相机进行组件温度估计时，错误的潜在原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Errors in component temperature estimations using thermal infrared cameras are primarily caused by image classification errors that vary with vegetation abundance, the exclusion of atmospheric radiation effects, and the uncertainties in short- and long-wave radiation transmittances, which may lead to inaccuracies in estimating soil and canopy temperatures.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 使用热红外相机进行温度估计的误差主要是由于图像分类错误，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化，排除了大气辐射效应，以及短波和长波辐射透过率的不确定性，这可能导致土壤和树冠温度估计的不准确。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: When employing eddy covariance systems for flux measurements, what are the potential consequences of incomplete energy balance closure on the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimates?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在使用涡度协方差系统进行通量测量时，能量平衡闭合不完全对蒸散发估计的准确性可能产生的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: In a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area, incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0 can lead to challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes like H and LE. This can affect the performance of models such as the TSEB model, which relies on accurate surface-air temperature differences.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，关于可用能量 Rn−G0 的能量平衡闭合不完全可能导致准确估计表面通量（如 H 和 LE）的挑战。这可能影响诸如 TSEB 模型等模型的性能，而该模型依赖于准确的表面-空气温度差。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential outcomes of implementing a multiscale observation system on studying eco-hydrological processes over heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 实施多尺度观测系统对研究异质表面的生态水文过程的潜在结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: A multiscale observation system, such as the one used in HiWATER, can capture complex eco-hydrological processes by providing diverse datasets from various scales and instruments. This approach can enhance understanding and modeling of interactions between different land cover types, such as oasis-desert interactions, and improve data quality through hierarchical nesting, addressing the challenges posed by heterogeneous landscapes.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测系统，如HiWATER所使用的，可以通过提供来自不同尺度和仪器的多样化数据集来捕捉复杂的生态水文过程。这种方法可以增强对不同土地覆盖类型之间相互作用的理解和建模，例如绿洲-沙漠相互作用，并通过层次嵌套提高数据质量，从而应对异质景观带来的挑战。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the goals of implementing multiscale observations in the collection of eco-hydrological data over heterogeneous surfaces?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在异质表面收集生态水文数据时，实施多尺度观测的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goals of implementing multiscale observations are to address the challenge of poor availability of such data in eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces, as well as to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes using hierarchically nested scales. This is achieved through instrumentation and intensive observation periods, such as those conducted during the HiWATER experiment.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 实施多尺度观测的目标是解决在异质表面上生态水文过程数据可用性差的问题，以及通过分层嵌套尺度捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。这是通过仪器设备和密集观测期来实现的，例如在HiWATER实验期间进行的观测。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to validate evapotranspiration estimation models using ground-based measurements in strongly advective environments?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在强对流环境中，使用地面测量数据验证蒸散发估算模型的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: It is important to validate evapotranspiration estimation models using ground-based measurements in strongly advective environments to ensure the accuracy of the model's estimates of evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET). Given the complexity and uncertainty in surface-air temperature differences in such environments, ground-based measurements provide reliable data for model validation, as demonstrated by the use of the TSEB model with soil and canopy component temperatures.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 在强烈的平流环境中，验证蒸散发估算模型使用地面测量数据是重要的，以确保模型对蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET）估算的准确性。鉴于在这种环境中地表与空气温度差异的复杂性和不确定性，地面测量提供了可靠的数据用于模型验证，正如使用土壤和冠层组分温度的TSEB模型所示。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are employed to ensure the quality control of datasets collected during multiscale eco-hydrological observations in heterogeneous surfaces?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在异质表面进行多尺度生态水文观测时，采用哪些程序来确保收集数据集的质量控制？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: All observational data from the HiWATER project were carefully quality controlled through sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation to ensure the reliability and accuracy of the dataset.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: HiWATER项目的所有观测数据经过了严格的质量控制，包括传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成，以确保数据集的可靠性和准确性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are eddy covariance measurements processed to correct for potential errors in flux data collected from non-uniform underlying surfaces?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 涡度协方差测量如何处理，以纠正从非均匀底面收集的通量数据中的潜在错误？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The flux data from eddy covariance measurements are processed using several correction steps: despiking of outlier values, time lag correction, coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, sonic temperature correction, and density (WPL) correction. Quality evaluation of flux values includes tests for atmospheric stationarity and turbulence similarity characteristics.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差测量的通量数据经过几个校正步骤处理：去除异常值、时间延迟校正、坐标旋转、频率响应校正、声温校正和密度（WPL）校正。通量值的质量评估包括对大气平稳性和湍流相似性特征的测试。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What instrumentation and procedural strategies are utilized to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes in an oasis-desert interaction study?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠相互作用研究中，采用了哪些仪器和程序策略来捕捉多尺度生态水文过程？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The HiWATER project employed a hierarchical nested scale approach with instruments such as flux observation matrices of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations. Intensive observation periods included the use of a sparse network of EC towers and automatic meteorological stations across different landscapes, as well as airborne remote sensing missions using LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: HiWATER项目采用了分层嵌套尺度的方法，使用了涡度协方差塔的通量观测矩阵、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站等仪器。密集观测期包括在不同景观中使用稀疏的EC塔和自动气象站网络，以及利用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的航空遥感任务。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements enabled the accurate separation of evapotranspiration components in heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在异质景观中准确分离蒸散发成分成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of high-precision thermal infrared cameras to obtain soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, as well as the application of the Two-Source Energy Balance (TSEB) model, enabled the accurate separation of evapotranspiration components in heterogeneous landscapes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 高精度热红外相机的使用可以获得土壤和冠层组件的辐射温度，同时应用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型，使得在异质景观中准确分离蒸散发成分成为可能。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods using eddy covariance systems and remote sensing contribute to understanding eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert areas?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 涡度协方差系统和遥感的数据收集方法如何有助于理解绿洲-沙漠地区的生态水文过程？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Eddy covariance systems and remote sensing technologies such as LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, and multi-angle thermal imagers provide multiscale and multidisciplinary data that help capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes, enabling a deeper understanding of interactions in oasis-desert areas.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统和遥感技术，如激光雷达、成像光谱仪和多角度热成像仪，提供了多尺度和多学科的数据，帮助捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，从而加深对绿洲-沙漠地区相互作用的理解。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions are necessary for implementing a multiscale observation experiment in a complex landscape like the Heihe River Basin?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在像黑河流域这样复杂的景观中实施多尺度观测实验需要哪些条件？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Implementing a multiscale observation experiment in a complex landscape like the Heihe River Basin requires a hierarchically nested instrumentation setup, including eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and remote sensing platforms, along with intensive observation periods and continuous hydrometeorological observations to capture multi-scale processes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在像黑河流域这样复杂的景观中实施多尺度观测实验需要一个分层嵌套的仪器设置，包括涡度协方差塔、自动气象站和遥感平台，以及密集的观测周期和持续的水文气象观测，以捕捉多尺度过程。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why do composite temperature separation approaches face limitations in arid regions for data collection and analysis?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的数据收集和分析中面临限制的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Composite temperature separation approaches are limited in arid regions primarily due to image classification errors, which vary with vegetation abundance. These errors can cause soil pixels to be misclassified as vegetation pixels, leading to overestimated canopy temperatures. Furthermore, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance contributes to uncertainties in temperature estimates, complicating the separation of soil and canopy temperatures.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的应用受到限制，主要是由于图像分类错误，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。这些错误可能导致土壤像素被错误分类为植被像素，从而导致冠层温度的高估。此外，忽视大气向上辐射和透射率也会导致温度估计的不确定性，进一步复杂化了土壤和冠层温度的分离。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is the availability of multiscale observations crucial for understanding eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces, and why might they be difficult to obtain?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测的可用性对于理解异质表面的生态水文过程至关重要，因为它能够提供不同空间和时间尺度上的数据，从而揭示复杂的生态和水文相互作用。然而，获取这些观测数据可能会很困难，因为需要在多个尺度上进行高精度的测量，这通常涉及到技术、成本和时间的挑战。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces is challenging due to the poor availability of multiscale observations. These observations are crucial for capturing the complexity of interactions within ecosystems, such as oasis-desert interactions. The difficulty in obtaining such data lies in the need for extensive instrumentation across hierarchically nested scales, which involves complex setups like eddy covariance towers, remote sensing, and ground-based measurements to capture the multiscale and multidisciplinary data necessary for comprehensive analysis.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在异质表面上提升生态水文过程的研究面临挑战，主要是由于多尺度观测数据的稀缺。这些观测数据对于捕捉生态系统内部复杂的相互作用（例如绿洲-沙漠相互作用）至关重要。获取此类数据的困难在于需要在层次嵌套的尺度上进行广泛的仪器布置，这涉及复杂的设置，如涡度协方差塔、遥感技术和地面测量，以捕捉进行全面分析所需的多尺度和多学科数据。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your judgment on the effectiveness of using eddy covariance systems as a data collection method for measuring evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您对在异质景观中使用涡度协方差系统作为测量蒸散发的数据收集方法的有效性有何判断？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The eddy covariance system is effective for measuring evapotranspiration, especially when combined with ground-based measurements to partition ET into its components. However, challenges such as incomplete energy balance closure and uncertainties due to strong advective environments can affect its accuracy.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统在测量蒸散发方面非常有效，特别是当与地面测量结合使用时，可以将蒸散发分解为其组成部分。然而，能量平衡闭合不完全和强对流环境带来的不确定性等挑战可能会影响其准确性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do you evaluate the challenges in obtaining multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes, especially in terms of data availability and quality control?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在获取生态水文过程的多尺度观测时面临的挑战，特别是在数据可用性和质量控制方面？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The challenges in obtaining multiscale observations are significant due to the poor availability of data and the need for rigorous quality control. The HiWATER experiment addresses these challenges through hierarchically nested scales and a comprehensive quality control process, but the complexity of eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces remains a hurdle.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 获取多尺度观测的数据挑战显著，主要由于数据的稀缺性和对严格质量控制的需求。HiWATER实验通过分层嵌套的尺度和全面的质量控制过程来应对这些挑战，但在异质表面上生态水文过程的复杂性仍然是一个障碍。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your assessment of the potential for using high-resolution thermal infrared cameras in enhancing the accuracy of evapotranspiration models?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对使用高分辨率热红外相机提高蒸散发模型准确性的潜力的评估是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: High-resolution thermal infrared cameras have significant potential to enhance the accuracy of evapotranspiration models by providing robust soil and vegetation component temperature data. This can improve the separation of E and T from ET, particularly in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas, as demonstrated by their reliable performance in combination with the TSEB model.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 高分辨率热红外相机在提高蒸散发模型的准确性方面具有重要潜力，因为它们能够提供可靠的土壤和植被温度数据。这可以改善在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域中将蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）从蒸散发（ET）中分离的能力，正如它们与TSEB模型结合时所展示的可靠性能。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data from heterogeneous land surfaces can be accurately collected and processed for evapotranspiration estimation.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白如何准确收集和处理来自异质土地表面的数据以估算蒸散发。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The collection and processing of data from heterogeneous land surfaces for evapotranspiration estimation involve using multiscale observation techniques, as seen in the HiWATER experiment. This includes the use of eddy covariance systems, thermal infrared cameras, and the partitioning of data into soil and canopy components for more accurate modeling. Challenges such as image classification errors and incomplete energy balance closure are addressed through ground measurements and model adjustments.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 从异质土地表面收集和处理数据以估算蒸散发涉及使用多尺度观测技术，如HiWATER实验所示。这包括使用涡度协方差系统、热红外相机，以及将数据划分为土壤和树冠组件以实现更准确的建模。通过地面测量和模型调整来解决图像分类错误和能量平衡闭合不完整等挑战。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m unsure about the challenges faced in collecting multiscale eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert areas.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在绿洲-沙漠地区收集多尺度生态水文数据所面临的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The challenges in collecting multiscale eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert areas include the poor availability of multiscale observations and the complexity of capturing interactions across different landscapes. The HiWATER experiment addresses this by using hierarchically nested scales and a sparse network of instruments such as EC towers and automatic meteorological stations. These setups help capture the diverse eco-hydrological processes.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区收集多尺度生态水文数据的挑战包括多尺度观测的稀缺性和捕捉不同景观之间相互作用的复杂性。HiWATER实验通过使用分层嵌套的尺度和稀疏的仪器网络，如生态系统碳通量塔和自动气象站，来应对这些挑战。这些设置有助于捕捉多样的生态水文过程。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please provide an overview of potential datasets that can be used for studying eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems, and discuss their data quality control measures.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请提供一个潜在数据集的概述，这些数据集可以用于研究绿洲-沙漠系统中的生态水文过程，并讨论它们的数据质量控制措施。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets for studying eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems include those from the Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER), which comprises flux observation matrices, remote sensing data, and synchronical ground measurements. The data quality is ensured through sensor calibration, careful data collection, processing, and generation. These datasets are available at platforms such as figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 研究绿洲-沙漠系统生态水文过程的潜在数据集包括来自黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）的数据，该研究包括通量观测矩阵、遥感数据和同步地面测量。数据质量通过传感器校准、仔细的数据收集、处理和生成得以保证。这些数据集可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心等平台上获取。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please outline the experimental setup and instruments used in the HiWATER project to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes, noting any innovative techniques applied.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请概述HiWATER项目中用于捕捉多尺度生态水文过程的实验设置和仪器，注意任何应用的创新技术。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The HiWATER project utilized a hierarchically nested setup with a sparse network of instruments, including eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations across various landscapes. Innovative techniques included the use of hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing with LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: HiWATER项目采用了分层嵌套的设置，配备了稀疏的仪器网络，包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站，覆盖不同的景观。创新技术包括使用高分辨率的航空遥感技术，如激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。
